formattedAddress: 687 W 204th St, New York, NY 10034, USA
adrFormatAddress: 687 W 204th St, New York, NY 10034, USA

originalText.text: Ms. Alison is a fantastic piano teacher and we are so happy with our son’s progress! (He’s 9 and has been studying with Ms.Alison for several years.) She is imaginative, experienced, diligent and disciplined- just the right balance of fun and rigor- and instills a love of the instrument and repertoire. She has an easygoing and caring bond with each of her students, and carefully tailors her approach to each individual young musician. Also, with several recitals a year, there’s a nice sense of community.among her students- of all levels. We would happily recommend her to anyone looking for an excellent piano teacher for their child!

originalText.text:
As a new adult student, I was looking for a patient piano teacher who was adept with deploying a range of methodologies to make the most of my time. Alison has been a thoughtful guide on my musical journey. She brought me from zero experience to having a firm grasp on fundamentals.

To everyone young or old, I highly recommend Alison’s experience, patience and thoughtful approach to teaching. I have thoroughly enjoyed every piano lesson. After every lesson, I feel that much more inspired to keep playing and practicing.

To everyone young or old, I highly recommend Alison’s experience, patience and thoughtful approach to teaching. I have thoroughly enjoyed every piano lesson. After every lesson, I feel that much more inspired to keep playing and practicing.

originalText.text: Our daughter studied with Ms. Alison from age 8-18. She is now in college and plays casually for friends and family. She is skilled enough that she can pick up  new music and work through it just like she would when she was taking lessons.

text.text: Our daughter studied with Ms. Alison from age 8-18. She is now in college and plays casually for friends and family. She is skilled enough that she can pick up  new music and work through it just like she would when she was taking lessons.

originalText.text: Our 7 year old daughter has been taking lessons with Ms Alison for a year and she has already come so far! Ms Alison provides really well-structured lessons but leaves room for spontaneity and innovation. She's incredibly patient and helped us to organize our daughter's homework and practice in a way that was really helpful for her ADHD. The recitals are really welcoming and fun for all.

text.text: Our 7 year old daughter has been taking lessons with Ms Alison for a year and she has already come so far! Ms Alison provides really well-structured lessons but leaves room for spontaneity and innovation. She's incredibly patient and helped us to organize our daughter's homework and practice in a way that was really helpful for her ADHD. The recitals are really welcoming and fun for all.

originalText.text: My daughter has thrived while studying with Alison. She always understands exactly what level my daughter is at, and what she needs to learn to advance to the next level. Other teachers we tried previously were positively apathetic in comparison to Alison. Following the Royal Conservatory of Music curriculum and annual grade level testing has been motivating for my daughter, who needs a "reason" to practice. Alison also stands out as a piano teacher because she not only cares about what goes on in her weekly lessons, but also what happens at home during valuable practice time. Over the years she has created systems to aid parents and kids with the dreaded nightly practice sessions. Most recently, Alison has begun using the Better Practice App with her students, and truly it has saved my sanity (and increased nightly practice time by a lot!). If your child is serious about wanting to learn how to play the piano well, Ms. Alison is a great teacher.
